result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith Charles Bauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Placing Foreign Objects in Edibles, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.325.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution within 30 days.  Reserve restitution as ordered from the Crime Victim Compensation Program.

timeConds.notes: Good time granted.  Work release privileges granted.  Credit for 1 day served.  Immediate report.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Various letters to the Court Re: Keith Bauer filed by Atty Hillestad
Sentencing hearing on August 1, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Keith Charles Bauer in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached by counsel, in exchange to plea to count 1, State will recommend 3 yrs. probation, cap jail at 60 days, counsel free to argue.  Court advises defendant of charge in count 1/max penalties, felony prohibitions.  Defendant enters plea of no contest.  Plea Colloquy. Court advises defendant of his constitutional rights; finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of count 1, Order PSI.  Sent. Hrg. set.  Any conditions of bond previously set are cont'd.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Letter to Court (copies mailed to counsel)
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 17, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Keith Charles Bauer in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties close to resolution, requests date @ 3 weeks out.  Referred to scheduling clerk.
Status conference on April 25, 2016 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Keith Charles Bauer in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to Suppress.  Witness A.W.B. Sworn & testified. Witness J.F. Sworn & testified.  Motion denied.  Referred to scheduling clerk for STC date.
A.B. is required to appear on 03/28/2016 at 2:30 pm
J.F. is required to appear on 03/28/2016 at 2:30 pm
S.M. is required to appear on 03/28/2016 at 2:30 pm
Done on the record.  Waiver form filed.

Defendant Keith Charles Bauer in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Defendant Keith Charles Bauer in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Here for bond hearing.  Defendant turned himself in.  Defendant f/t/a yesterday for PH, everyone else was here.  State requests cash bond of $2500.  Atty Hillestad informs court he filed motions schedule for 3/28/16 and Mr. Bauer was under the impression PH was to be held on that date as well.  We completed WOPH and willing to WPH today and do Arraignment, signature bond appropriate.  Court advises defendant of right to PH.  Defendant and Atty Hillestad agrees his WOPH done K&V.  State files Information with the clerk.  Atty Hillestad confirms received Information and waives further reading.  Court advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and constitutional rights.  Defendant stands mute, court enters NGP on his behalf.  State informs court defendant on a Signature Bond.  Court orders bond remain as previously set.

Attorney Roger M. Hillestad in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant f/t/a.  State requests court authorize warrant and no objection to Mr. Hillestad making a call to his client.  Court authorizes warrant.
Motion hearing at 03-28-2016 02:30 pm
Defendant's Motion to Suppress.
S.M. is required to appear on 03/08/2016 at 2:30 pm
Preliminary hearing at 03-08-2016 02:30 pm

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Keith Charles Bauer in court, in custody.   Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charges/max. penalties.  Same date range on all 3 counts, how are they distinguished?  3 separate incidents.  Court advises defendant of constitutional rights.  State requests $2500 Signature Bond with condition:  No contact with JTF either at her residence or at her place of employment and ask bond condition include a prohibition from being present of Bauer's Gas store.  Court releases defendant on $2500 Sign. Bond with condition:  No contact with JTF including at Bauer's Gas and her residence.  Add condition not be present at 110 W Main Street, Bauer's Gas.  If Bauer's Gas requests another proposal, they should get it to the DA.  Defendant wishes to contact an attorney before set PH.  Court shows WOTL for PH, set for AIA 1/19 @ 1:30 p.m.
